predictions.text: ISM Manufacturing PMI (headline) for October 2025 will print between 49.0 and 51.0 in ISM’s release due by 2025-11-01.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm the headline PMI value in the Institute for Supply Management’s October 2025 Report On Business press release; the value must be within 49.0–51.0.
evidence: https://www.ismworld.org/supply-management-news-and-reports/reports/ism-report-on-business/pmi/

Tariff threats and a Trump post erased roughly $2 trillion in U.S. market value, amplifying volatility ahead of key tech earnings. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/11/trump-post-costs-stocks-2-trillion-in-single-day.html
Shutdown impacts widen as layoffs mount; policy uncertainty elevated. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/10/11/us/politics/trump-government-shutdown-layoffs-democrats.html
monitoring_signals: Regional Fed manufacturing surveys (Empire State, Philly Fed) new orders and employment components
Supplier delivery times and inventory indices
Export orders and ISM prices paid
predictions.rationale: Mixed demand, tighter financial conditions, and volatility suggest mid-50s PMI unlikely; range-bound near 50 is plausible.

predictions.text: U.S. nonfarm payrolls (change, total) for October 2025 will be between +110,000 and +230,000 in the BLS Employment Situation release by 2025-11-08.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the total nonfarm payroll employment change from the BLS Employment Situation news release for October 2025; seasonally adjusted headline change must fall within +110k to +230k.
evidence: Policy uncertainty and shutdown risks can dampen hiring momentum. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/10/11/us/politics/trump-government-shutdown-layoffs-democrats.html
Volatility spike may correlate with cautious hiring. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/11/trump-post-costs-stocks-2-trillion-in-single-day.html
https://www.bls.gov/schedule/news_release/empsit.htm
predictions.rationale: Labor market cooling but not collapsing; range captures modest growth amid uncertainty.

predictions.text: U.S. unemployment rate (U-3) for October 2025 will print between 4.1% and 4.4% in the BLS release by 2025-11-08.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the seasonally adjusted U-3 unemployment rate from the October 2025 BLS Employment Situation; rate must be within 4.1%–4.4%.
evidence: Hiring headwinds and volatility may nudge jobless rate modestly higher. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/11/trump-post-costs-stocks-2-trillion-in-single-day.html
https://www.bls.gov/schedule/news_release/empsit.htm
monitoring_signals: Household survey employment-population ratio and participation rate
Flows: unemployed to employed, labor force entrants
predictions.rationale: Participation dynamics and softer hiring point to a slightly elevated but contained unemployment rate.

predictions.text: U.S. Advance Retail Sales (MoM, SA) for September 2025 will print between -0.2% and +0.3% in the Census release due by 2025-10-16.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm the month-over-month percent change for Advance Retail and Food Services Sales (seasonally adjusted) from the U.S. Census Bureau’s September 2025 release; result must be within -0.2% to +0.3%.
evidence: Consumer value-seeking behavior suggests restrained nominal growth. https://www.marketwatch.com/story/mcdonalds-is-bringing-back-its-popular-monopoly-game-and-analysts-say-it-could-lift-sales-52bb55c4
Policy uncertainty could weigh on discretionary spending. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/10/11/us/politics/trump-government-shutdown-layoffs-democrats.html
https://www.census.gov/retail/index.html
monitoring_signals: Credit/debit card trackers (bank high-frequency spending data)
predictions.rationale: Soft real demand and lower gas prices likely offset by resilience in services; narrow MoM range.

predictions.text: S&P Global U.S. Composite PMI (final) for October 2025 will print between 51.0 and 53.5 in the release due by 2025-11-05.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check S&P Global’s press release for the final U.S. Composite PMI reading for October 2025; the index must be within 51.0–53.5.
evidence: Services demand moderates while manufacturing stabilizes near 50.
https://www.pmi.spglobal.com/Public/Release/PressReleases
Market volatility and uncertainty temper activity. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/11/trump-post-costs-stocks-2-trillion-in-single-day.html
monitoring_signals: ISM Manufacturing and Services new orders
predictions.rationale: Composite activity likely modestly expansionary, constrained by tighter financial conditions.

predictions.text: Euro area unemployment rate for September 2025 will print between 6.3% and 6.6% in Eurostat’s release due by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Eurostat’s seasonally adjusted euro area unemployment rate for September 2025; the published rate must lie within 6.3%–6.6%.
evidence: Mixed growth backdrop with soft external demand (China trade). https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/11/berkshires-japanese-stock-positions-top-30-billion.html
https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat
predictions.rationale: Labor markets remain relatively resilient but show early slack; steady range likely.

predictions.text: From 2025-10-12 close to 2025-11-30 close, iShares Russell 2000 ETF (IWM) will underperform SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) by at least 2.5 percentage points based on adjusted close percentage change.
predictions.verification_criteria: Compute percentage change in adjusted close from 2025-10-12 close to 2025-11-30 close for IWM and SPY (e.g., Yahoo Finance). IWM’s change minus SPY’s change must be ≤ -2.5 pp.
evidence: Concentration risk in S&P 500 favors mega-cap resilience vs small caps. https://www.marketwatch.com/story/why-your-s-p-500-index-fund-might-be-more-risky-than-the-internet-bubble-af1050e6
Heightened policy/volatility shock risk. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/11/trump-post-costs-stocks-2-trillion-in-single-day.html
Investor rotation dynamics within AI trade. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/11/artificial-intelligence-bitcoin-as-top-blackrock-etf-place.html
monitoring_signals: Breadth metrics and equal-weight vs cap-weight dispersion
predictions.rationale: Tight credit and risk-off skew typically pressure small caps relative to megacaps.

predictions.text: ICE BofA U.S. Corporate Index Option-Adjusted Spread (FRED: BAMLCC0A0CM) will close at or above 1.20% on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify any daily close at or above 1.20% in FRED series BAMLCC0A0CM between 2025-10-12 and 2025-11-30 (UTC).
evidence: Macro/policy uncertainty elevates risk premia. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/10/11/us/politics/trump-government-shutdown-layoffs-democrats.html
Rates volatility remains a tail risk. https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/MOVE
https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/BAMLCC0A0CM
monitoring_signals: Primary IG issuance volumes and concessions
predictions.rationale: A modest widening episode is plausible amid earnings, policy and growth jitters.

predictions.text: LME Copper 3-month official settlement price will reach at or above $9,800 per metric ton on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm any LME official 3-month copper settlement at ≥ $9,800/mt via LME official prices or reputable data vendors (e.g., LME.com daily official prices) by 2025-11-30.
evidence: EV charging and grid build-out narratives support copper demand. https://spectrum.ieee.org/ev-charging-solid-state-transformers
Positioning rotations across AI/crypto risk assets. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/11/artificial-intelligence-bitcoin-as-top-blackrock-etf-place.html
monitoring_signals: LME/SHFE copper inventories and warehouse cancellations
Mine supply disruptions and treatment charges
predictions.rationale: Tight medium-term fundamentals and risk rotations can trigger upside test despite macro noise.

predictions.text: EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage (Lower 48 total working gas) will print at or above 3,850 Bcf in at least one Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report published by 2025-11-15.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report tables; confirm Lower 48 total working gas at ≥ 3,850 Bcf in any weekly report published on or before 2025-11-15.
evidence: Seasonal injections typically peak into late Oct/early Nov.
European gas price volatility underscores storage incentives. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/11/artificial-intelligence-bitcoin-as-top-blackrock-etf-place.html
ICE Endex Dutch TTF front-month sensitivity. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/11/
monitoring_signals: NOAA HDD/CDD forecasts and degree day models
Lower 48 dry gas production and pipeline maintenance
LNG feedgas deliveries and export capacity utilization
Spot/forward Henry Hub and regional basis
predictions.rationale: Strong production and seasonal builds likely push inventories to high end of range.

predictions.text: Apple (AAPL) fiscal Q4 2025 Services revenue will be between $24.5B and $26.0B, per the company’s earnings release published by 2025-11-10.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check Apple’s fiscal Q4 2025 earnings press release or 10-K/10-Q; confirm Services segment revenue reported within $24.5–$26.0 billion.
evidence: Ongoing shift toward subscription and services ARPU resilience.
AI adoption and app ecosystem tailwinds. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/11/open-ai-silicon-valley-tech-startup.html
https://investor.apple.com/earnings/
monitoring_signals: App Store billings and subscription growth commentary
FX rates (USD index) and regional mix
Installed base growth and device attach rates
predictions.rationale: Services growth remains the steadier pillar amid hardware cycles and FX.
